title: Arctic Weather Satellite: advancing weather forecasting in a changing climate
summary: The effects of the climate crisis are felt more acutely in the Arctic than anywhere else on the planet. The weather in the Arctic is not only severe, but it changes extremely quickly. More frequent data are urgently needed to improve weather forecasts for this susceptible polar region.

title: The Exploration Company to Increase Workforce by 40%
summary: In-space logistics provider The Exploration Company has launched a large recruitment drive. The company is currently hiring for 51 open positions. Founded in 2021, the Exploration Company is developing a spacecraft called Nyx that will be capable of carrying cargo and crew to and from space or acting as a free flyer to supplement the […]

title: Intuitive Machines seeks to take over NASA’s VIPER lunar rover
summary: Intuitive Machines says it is organizing a coalition of organizations that will offer to take over a NASA lunar rover mission, launching it on one of the company’s landers.

title: NASA chief to scientists on budget cuts: “I feel your pain”
summary: "I can't go and print the dollars."

title: New Glenn’s maiden flight approaches as hardware undergoes testing
summary: With flight hardware being tested, recovery rehearsals underway, and production facilities growing, Blue Origin is becoming a hive of more visible activity as the company rapidly approaches the first flight of its orbital class rocket, New Glenn.

title: NASA to Provide Crew Flight Test Status Update
summary: NASA will host a media teleconference at 1 p.m. EDT, Wednesday, Aug. 14, to provide an update on the agency’s Boeing Crew Flight Test. Mission managers continue to evaluate the Starliner spacecraft’s readiness in advance of decisional meetings no earlier than next week regarding the return of NASA astronauts Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams. Audio […]

title: NASA Challenge Seeks ‘Cooler’ Solutions for Deep Space Exploration
summary: NASA’s Human Lander Challenge, or HuLC, is now open and accepting submissions for its second year. As NASA aims to return astronauts to the Moon through its Artemis campaign in preparation for future missions to Mars, the agency is seeking ideas from college and university students for evolved supercold, or cryogenic, propellant applications for human […]

title: Terran Orbital removes Rivada constellation from revenue backlog
summary: Terran Orbital has removed the broadband constellation it is developing for Rivada Space Networks from the backlog of revenues in its accounts, even though the manufacturer still expects to get $2.4 billion from their contract.

title: Earth’s Crest Over the Lunar Horizon
summary: This view of the Earth’s crest over the lunar horizon was taken on July 29, 1971, during the Apollo 15 lunar landing mission. Astronauts David Scott, Alfred Worden, and James Irwin launched from NASA’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida aboard a Saturn V launch vehicle. Designed to explore the Moon over longer periods, greater ranges, and […]
